tweezer.ixo.decorators module¶

class tweezer.ixo.decorators.TerminalInfoSwitch(showInfos=False)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Switch to turn on or off informative output when a function is called in the terminal

class tweezer.ixo.decorators.TerminalInformation(fn, showInfos=True)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Decorator class that allows you to change the way a function is called at run-time.

Adjusted for Python 2.7 from Python Cookbook 3, 9.9

If combined with other decorators, use as the outermost one.

Usage: >>> @TerminalInformation ... def fn(x=4, y=7): ... return x + y >>> >>> fn() >>> fn.showInfos = True >>> fn()

Methods

tweezer.ixo.decorators.fail(message)[source]¶
tweezer.ixo.decorators.informative(terminalInfoSwitch)[source]¶

Add informative output to a function call.

This is a decorator factory. It returns a decorator. The behaviour of the decorated function can be changed by changing the properties of the terminalInfoSwitch instance. This can be done at run-time.

Usage: >>> tis = TerminalInfoSwitch() >>> @informative(tis) ... def fn(x=4, y=7): ... return x + y >>> >>> fn() >>> tis.showInfos = False >>> fn()

tweezer.ixo.objects module¶

class tweezer.ixo.objects.TweebotDictionary[source]¶

Bases: tweezer.ixo.objects.TweebotDictionary

TweebotDictionary is build on a namedtuple for easy access of variables with the dot notation. In addition to the namedtuple it allows for default values to be set and extra values to be added when needed. However, it preserves the immutability of the namedtuple on first glance. To set a value after initiation use

d = d._replace(key=value)

Attributes

Methods

Generator for all files contained in a directory

Parameters:directory – (path) root directory
tweezer.ixo.os_.get_new_subdirs(old_directory_list, new_directory_list)[source]¶

Gets new directories by comparing old and new stage of this directory. This assumes that there are new directories added and none deleted from the the old ones.

Parameters:
  • old_directory_list – (list) of directory at an earlier stage
  • new_directory_list – (list) of directory at a later stage
